definition: to suppress by armed force/to send a punitive expedition against/to crusade against
to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
to cut down/to fell/to dispatch an expedition against/to attack/to boast/Taiwan pr. [fa1]

sentences.english: One summer, Cao Cao was leading his troops to fight against Zhang Xiu.
sentences.chinese: 有一年夏天，曹操率领部队去讨伐张绣。

sentences.english: The weakness is that it takes its crusading a little far.
sentences.chinese: 而美中不足的是在进行讨伐鞭挞的时候走的有点远了。

sentences.english: Thats part of it. You forgot the Fed and the Dems.
sentences.chinese: 讨伐不全面，你有选择地遗漏了美联储和民主党。

sentences.english: Slay 10 consecutive Oni in an Infinite Mission.
sentences.chinese: 在无限讨伐中连续挑战10回。

sentences.english: He headed the troops to crusade against the rebellion.
One summer, Cao Cao was leading his troops in a punitive expedition a-gainst Zhang Xiu.
sentences.chinese: 有一年夏天，曹操率领部队去讨伐张绣。

sentences.english: In 1927 summer participation punitive expedition Xia Douyinrebel army's fight.
sentences.chinese: 1927年夏参加讨伐夏斗寅叛军的战斗。

sentences.english: Is the US girding its loins for another great crusade against evil?
sentences.chinese: 美国是会为了再一次大举讨伐邪恶而摩拳擦掌？

sentences.english: He led the charge of jihad on the internet.
sentences.chinese: 他在互联网上领导讨伐异教徒活动。

sentences.english: He was surprised at not finding himself exposed to these silent batteries.
sentences.chinese: 使他吃惊的是他并没有感到自己受到了无言的讨伐。

sentences.english: No hunger no punitive expedition, only expect or endless waiting.
sentences.chinese: 没有饥渴也没有讨伐，只有期望抑或无止尽的等待。

definition: to go on a punitive expedition
to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
to go on or send a punitive expedition
to dispatch an army/to send troops
to change sides in a war/turncoat
